isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - SELF-STEERING AXLE ASSEMBLIES - REMOVAL

svcprocinfo.para: This section contains removal procedures for the self-steering lift axle assembly and the components mounted on the lift axle assembly. Removal procedures for the control panels and panel mounted components are located in the CONTROLS section .

svcsubproc.title: AIR LINES - GENERAL
svcsubproc.para: Air lines can be detached from the quick-connect fittings as follows:

step1.para: Depress and hold the retaining collar where the line enters the fitting.
Pull the air line straight out of the fitting
Release the retaining collar.

svcsubproc.title: LIFT AXLE ASSEMBLY
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 21 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Remove the tires/wheels from the lift axle to provide clearance during removal of the mounting fasteners.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; support the lift axle to remove strain from the mounting points and to prevent sudden movement once the lift axle is free.

step1.para: Support the lift axle assembly to prevent it from dropping when the mounting fasteners are removed.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.
Disconnect and label all supply and control air lines from the lift axle assembly .

item.para: supply line to axle mounted tank (at tank)
brake control line to axle mounted brake relay valve (at valve)
supply line from axle mounted solenoid to pressure regulator (at solenoid)
delivery/control line from pressure regulator to load bag quick release valve (at valve)

step1.para: Disconnect electrical connection to the lift axle solenoid.
Support the lift axle assembly to prevent it from dropping when the mounting fasteners are removed.

Remove the mounting hardware securing the lift axle assembly to the vehicle frame (both sides). If Huck fasteners are used, remove the Huck fasteners using an approved method. Refer to Service Section S01001Y, Group 01, in the Master Service Manual for the approved removal methods.
Lower and remove the lift axle assembly.

svcsubproc.title: LOAD BAG
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 21
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
If it will help provide access, remove the tire/wheel from the side of the lift axle with the defective load bag.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.
Using a jack, raise and support the lift axle assembly at its normal ride height.
Disconnect the air line at the fitting on the load bag.
Remove the air line fitting for transfer to the replacement bag.
Remove the mounting hardware (nut and washer) securing the bag air stem to the top mounting plate.
Remove the bag mounting hardware (bolts and washers) from under the bottom mounting plate.

note.para: To perform the following step it may be necessary to loosen the mounting bolts securing the bag's upper mounting bracket.

step1.para: Remove the remaining mounting hardware (bolt and washer) securing the bag to the upper mounting plate.
Remove the load bag. Retain all mounting hardware for use with the replacement bag.

svcsubproc.title: LIFT BAG/LIFT BAG QRV
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 22 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.

note.para: Before performing the next step, check the areas around the lift bag to determine which direction provides the most clearance for bag removal.

step1.para: If necessary for clearance, remove the tire/wheel from the side of the lift axle with the defective lift bag.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.
Disconnect the air line at the fitting on the lift bag QRV (item 4), located at the rear of the lift bag.

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. LIFT BAG QUICK RELEASE VALVE AND QUICK CONNECT AIR FITTING

step1.para: Remove the QRV (with air line fitting) for transfer to the replacement bag.

note.para: The lift axle must be in the lowered position to gain access to the front of the lift bag.

step1.para: At the front end of the lift bag, remove the cotter pin that secures the pivot pin (item 2) used to join the lift bag pivot plate to the lift axle swingarm assembly.
Remove the pivot pin by tapping it out of the hinge joint.
Using a jack, raise the lift axle to allow access to the front of the lift bag.
Remove the mounting hardware, securing the pivot plate to the front of the lift bag.
Remove the mounting hardware (nut and washer) securing the bag air stem to the rear mounting plate. This frees the rear of the lift bag.
Remove the lift bag. Retain all mounting hardware for use with the replacement bag.

svcsubproc.title: QUICK RELEASE VALVE FOR LOAD BAGS
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 23 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Bleed all air from the lift axle system.
Disconnect and label all air lines connected to the quick release valve (item 8).
Remove the mounting hardware securing the quick release valve to its mounting bracket.
Remove the air line fittings from the defective valve for transfer to the replacement valve.

svcsubproc.title: FULL FUNCTION RELAY VALVE (BRAKES)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 23 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Drain all air from the system.

Remove the load bag QRV mounting bracket, with the QRV (item 8) attached, from the air tank mounting straps. Position the QRV and bracket to allow clearance for removing the relay valve. Disconnect air lines from the QRV, if necessary.
Disconnect and label all air lines connected to the relay valve (item 10).
Remove relay valve from air tank and separate the air line fittings for transfer to the replacement valve.

svcsubproc.title: PRESSURE PROTECTION VALVE
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 23 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.
Disconnect and label the air line connected to the valve (item 7).
Remove pressure protection valve from air tank and separate the air line fittings for transfer to the replacement valve.

svcsubproc.title: FIVE PORT VALVE/SOLENOID
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 23 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.
Disconnect electrical connection to the solenoid (item 14).
Disconnect and label all air lines connected to the solenoid.
Remove the two solenoid mounting bolts from the front of the mounting plate.
Remove solenoid and separate the air line fittings for transfer to the replacement solenoid.

svcsubproc.title: AXLE MOUNTED TANK
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 23 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.

note.para: Lift axle should be in the lowered position.

step1.para: Remove the load bag QRV mounting bracket, with the QRV (item 8) attached, from the air tank mounting straps. Position the QRV and bracket to allow clearance for removing the air tank (1). Disconnect air lines from the QRV, if necessary.
Disconnect and label all air lines connected to the axle mounted tank (1) and all remaining tank mounted components/valves (brake relay valve, item 10, pressure protection valve, item 7).
Remove the brake relay valve (item 10) from the air tank.
Remove the pressure protection valve (item 7) from the air tank.
Remove the mounting hardware securing the tank mounting straps to the axle frame, and remove the tank and mounting straps from the axle assembly.
Separate the mounting straps from the air tank for transfer to the replacement tank.
Remove the air line fittings and drain cock from the tank for transfer to the replacement tank.

svcsubproc.title: BRAKE MECHANISM
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Group 04 BRAKES in the Master Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: UPPER ARM BUSHINGS
svcsubproc.para: The self-steering lift axle has four arm bushings on each side: upper arm, front and rear; and lower arm, front and rear. To prevent the axle from dropping unexpectedly, and/or placing undue stress on axle components; always keep one set of arms connected during bushing replacement. In other words, replace the bushings in both upper (or lower) arms first; then reconnect those arms before disconnecting the other arms. Always support the axle during the entire removal/installation procedure.
Refer to FIGURE 22 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Remove the tires/wheels from the lift axle.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; support the axle assembly to remove strain from the pivot points and to prevent sudden movement once the upper arm is free.

step1.para: Support the axle assembly to prevent it from shifting when the upper arm is disconnected.

note.para: It may be necessary to remove the load bag or other components to perform the next step. See the appropriate Removal procedure.

step1.para: Remove the mounting hardware (item 3) securing the upper arm front and rear pivot points to the axle assembly. Repeat on opposite side. If Huck fasteners are used, remove the Huck fasteners using an approved method. Refer to Service Section S01001Y, Group 01, in the Master Service Manual for the approved removal methods.
Remove the upper arm to allow access to the arm bushings.
Remove both bushings from the upper arms and retain any hardware for use with the replacement bushings, if necessary.

svcsubproc.title: LOWER ARM BUSHINGS
svcsubproc.para: The self-steering lift axle has four arm bushings on each side: upper arm, front and rear; and lower arm, front and rear. To prevent the axle from dropping unexpectedly, and/or placing undue stress on axle components; always keep one set of arms connected during bushing replacement. In other words, replace the bushings in both upper (or lower) arms first; then reconnect those arms before disconnecting the other arms. Always support the axle during the entire removal/installation procedure.
Refer to FIGURE 22 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Remove the tires/wheels from the lift axle.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.

note.para: The lift axle must be in the lowered position to gain access to the front of the lift bag.

step1.para: At the front end of the lift bag, remove the cotter pin that secures the pivot pin (item 2) used to join the lift bag pivot plate to the lift axle swingarm assembly. Repeat on opposite side.
Remove the pivot pin by tapping it out of the hinge joint. Repeat on opposite side.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; support the axle swing arm to remove strain from the pivot points and to prevent sudden movement once the swing arm is free.

step1.para: Support the axle assembly to prevent it from dropping when the lower arm is removed.

note.para: Due to the weight of the lower arm, it may be easier to complete the bushing replacement at each end separately. In other words, disconnect the rear pivot, replace the bushing, and reconnect the pivot before disconnecting the front pivot.

step1.para: At the lower arm rear pivot point, remove the mounting hardware (item 1) securing the arm to the axle assembly. Repeat on opposite side. If Huck fasteners are used, remove the Huck fasteners using an approved method. Refer to Service Section S01001Y, Group 01, in the Master Service Manual for the approved removal methods.
Position the lower arms and the axle assembly to allow access to the rear bushings.
Remove the rear bushings from the arms and retain any hardware for use with the replacement bushings, if necessary.

At the lower arm front pivot points, remove the mounting hardware (item 1) securing the arm to the hanger rails. Repeat on opposite side. If Huck fasteners are used, remove the Huck fasteners using an approved method. Refer to Service Section S01001Y, Group 01, in the Master Service Manual for the approved removal methods.
Lower the front of the arms to allow access to the bushings.
Remove the front bushings from the lower arms and retain any hardware for use with the replacement bushings, if necessary.
